transcript: the more orderly and cheerful were the troops. The greatest disorder and depres- sion had been in the baggage train he had passed that morning on the Znaim road seven miles away from the French. At Grunth also some ap- prehension and alarm could be felt, but the nearer Prince Andrew came to the French lines the more confident was the appearance of our troops.
